title: 109_hr6025
content: The Act may be cited as the "Alternative Liquid Transportation Fuel Promotion Act of 2006" and includes definitions. The Act, known as the "Alternative Liquid Transportation Fuel Promotion Act of 2006," provides definitions for terms like biomass, coal, and coal-to-liquid processes using Fischer-Tropsch reactions. The Act defines terms related to coal-to-liquid processes at Fischer-Tropsch facilities, including carbon emissions. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Energy. SEC. 3. COAL-TO-LIQUID FUEL LOAN GUARANTEE PROGRAM. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include large-scale coal-to-liquid facilities that produce at least 5,000 barrels a day of liquid transportation fuel. Authorization of appropriations is provided for loan guarantees for these projects. No loan guarantees shall be provided for projects after the tenth guarantee is issued or production capacity reaches 100,000 barrels per day of coal-to-liquid fuel. Loan guarantees may be given for large-scale coal-to-liquid facilities producing up to 20,000 barrels per day, with a non-federal funding requirement. To qualify for a loan guarantee under this title, a large-scale coal-to-liquid facility producing over 20,000 barrels of fuel per day must provide non-Federal funding for the excess production beyond that amount. The Coal-to-Liquid Facilities Loan Program is outlined in Section 4. The Coal-to-Liquid Facilities Loan Program defines eligible recipients as individuals, organizations, or entities planning to construct facilities producing at least 5,000 barrels per day of coal-to-liquid fuel. The Secretary will provide loans up to $20,000,000 for planning, permitting, and construction services. Applicants must submit required information for consideration, and a non-Federal match is required for loan eligibility. To be eligible for a loan under the Coal-to-Liquid Facilities Loan Program, recipients must provide a dollar-for-dollar non-Federal match. Repayment of the loan must be made within 5 years, and funds can come from any financing received for the facility's construction. $200,000,000 is authorized for this program. $200,000,000 appropriated for the Coal-to-Liquid Facilities Loan Program, available until expended. SEC. 5. STRATEGIC PETROLEUM RESERVE. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include a study on maintaining coal-to-liquid products in the Reserve, with a report to be submitted to the relevant committees within a year of the enactment of the Alternative Liquid Transportation Fuel Promotion Act of 2006. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to allow the Secretary to construct or lease storage facilities near pipeline infrastructure and military bases, as well as outside any state on the Gulf of Mexico coast. Additionally, Section 160 is amended to include petroleum products for storage in the Reserve. Section 167 is also amended to include coal-to-liquid products in the Reserve, with a limit of 20 percent of total petroleum products.
